title: I used to be crazy good at math, but now I'm struggling with Algebra. Am I doing something wrong? - Quora

response.answer_text: What you were crazy good at was Arithmetic. Algebra is the start of abstract Mathematics, which is a much harder thing to learn. There are no shortcuts. Read every word of every section, and do more problems than the teacher assigned. Always.

Unfortunately, Math is a skill that you need to actively use it to be good at it. You just gotta review some notes and eventually you’ll be able to recall those information with ease. It’s basically the same framework of languages and programming. Good luck.
